channel.title: Jarred client won't run on website?
channel.description:
For some reason my client will not run on my website, but if you download the same client and run it, it will work perfectly fine. Why? Webclient Code: [code] Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run

Get the latest Java technology at http://www.java.com/ [/code] And yes, it IS named client.jar in my websites directory.

item.title: Jarred client won't run on website?
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

sorry, i read the first part ( appletname=“client”.
İ was just giving you a base, that actually works. So you could get it to work before you add anything else.

Read full topic
item.source: Jarred client won't run on website?

item.title: Jarred client won't run on website?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“soapface, post:6, topic:445039”]Is that the whole Webclient Code?

As this is my Webclient code

[code]

Moltenscape

 

Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run

Get the latest Java technology at http://www.java.com/

WARNING: While waiting for client to load, do not click any other pages, refresh, or minimize the screen! The first time, it will take a long time to download the cache.

[/code][/quote] It's not the entire webpage, it's just the applet code (the code only for the client)

Read full topic

you could just add it in after -.- not having java is kinda rare nowadays. And i sas trying to help. Put it as “Client.jar” instead of “Client” btw.

item.title: Jarred client won't run on website?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

For some reason my client will not run on my website, but if you download the same client and run it, it will work perfectly fine. Why?

Webclient Code:

[code]<applet name="Client"code=“client.class” archive=“client.jar” width=“765px” height=“502px” align=“middle”>
Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run

Get the latest Java technology at http://www.java.com/

[/code]

And yes, it IS named client.jar in my websites directory.

Read full topic
item.source: Jarred client won't run on website?
